channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SPARK-11388] Build breaks due to the use of <p/> tags in javadoc.
item.description:
In java 8 self-closing tags are illegal. The build fails when I issue a publishLocal, for example:

launcher/publishLocal
[info] Packaging /media/hvanhovell/Data/QT/IT/Software/spark-pr/launcher/target/scala-2.10/spark-launcher_2.10-1.6.0-SNAPSHOT-sources.jar ...

item.summary: Build breaks due to the use of <p/> tags in javadoc.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Fix is done. Problem now is that https://issues.scala-lang.org/browse/SI-8479 is rearing its ugly head again...

Anyone able to reproduce this?

User 'hvanhovell' has created a pull request for this issue:
https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/9339
Resolved by https://github.com/apache/spark/pull/9339. I assume this was only affecting master/1.6 since i didn't see the class in question in 1.5.x?
